title: Clutch Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
To prevent body damage, do not spill brake and clutch fluid onto any area of the bodywork or the brake and clutch reservoirs.
Drain the brake and clutch fluid from the clutch master cylinder using the bleed process (see
If the master cylinder is to be disassembled, remove the nut and pivot bolt and remove the clutch lever assembly from the master cylinder.
The clutch switch is secured to its housing by two fixings. The clutch switch housing is a press fit to the clutch master cylinder.
Note the orientation of the clutch switch for installation.
Carefully detach the clutch switch assembly from the master cylinder.
Disconnect the clutch hose from the master cylinder and discard the two sealing washers.
Release the fixings, remove the clamp and remove the master cylinder.
